content.user_title: Build Better React UI with Proven Patterns
content.value_statement: React UI patterns help developers create responsive, accessible user interfaces. This skill provides battle-tested patterns for handling loading states, error handling, empty states, and form submissions that users expect.
actual_capabilities: Implement loading states that show only when no data exists
Handle errors with proper user feedback and retry options
Create empty states for lists and collections
Disable buttons during async operations with loading indicators
Apply optimistic UI updates for instant user feedback
Structure form submission with validation and error handling
limitations: Provides patterns and guidance only, does not generate full component code
Focuses on React with TypeScript, may not apply to other frameworks
Does not include actual UI components or libraries

prompt_templates.title: Basic Loading State
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me how to implement a loading state for a React data fetching component. The loading indicator should only appear when no data exists.

prompt_templates.title: Error Handling
prompt_templates.prompt: How should I handle errors in React components? Include proper error surfacing, retry functionality, and user feedback.

prompt_templates.title: Empty State Design
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an empty state component for a list in React. Include helpful text and action buttons for the user.

prompt_templates.title: Form Submission
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me the complete pattern for form submission in React including loading state, disable during submit, error handling, and success feedback.

output_examples.input: How do I implement a loading state for a list component that fetches data?
output: Check for errors first - show error state with retry option if present
Show loading indicator only when loading AND no data exists
Show empty state when data exists but has no items
Display the list when items are available

best_practices: Always surface errors to users with clear messages and retry options
Show loading indicators only when no cached data exists to prevent UI flicker
Disable buttons during async operations and show loading state on the button itself
anti_patterns: Never swallow errors silently - always log and show user feedback
Do not show loading spinners when cached data exists - causes visual flicker
Avoid submitting forms multiple times - always disable during submission

faq.question: Does this skill work with React Native?
faq.answer: Yes. The patterns apply to React Native with platform-specific component names like ActivityIndicator instead of Spinner.

faq.question: What data fetching libraries are supported?
faq.answer: Patterns work with React Query, Apollo, SWR, and any async data library. Loading and error states are universal concepts.

faq.question: Can I use these patterns with state management libraries?
faq.answer: Yes. Redux, Zustand, Recoil, and Jotai all benefit from these UI state patterns for loading, error, and empty states.

faq.question: Is user data stored or transmitted?
faq.answer: No. This is a documentation skill. It provides patterns only and does not access, store, or transmit any user data.

faq.question: Why do I see loading flicker on refetch?
faq.answer: You are likely showing loading state whenever loading is true. Only show loading when there is no cached data to display.

faq.question: How is this different from React documentation?
faq.answer: This skill provides battle-tested patterns from production experience. It covers common pitfalls and anti-patterns to avoid.
